summary: This document is a memorandum summarizing the testimony of retired FBI Special Agent Alan G. Sentinella before the Senate Select Committee (SSC) on May 21, 1975, regarding investigations into Martin Luther King, Jr., the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC), and Stanley Levison.
summary_one_paragraph: The memorandum details the testimony of Alan G. Sentinella, a retired FBI agent, before the Senate Select Committee on May 21, 1975, concerning investigations of Martin Luther King, Jr., the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC), and Stanley Levison. Sentinella's testimony covers topics such as telephone surveillance practices, alleged communist connections of King's associates, the objectives of the investigations, and his recollections of the Bureau's efforts, including the alleged lack of responsiveness to civil rights complications in the South. The memorandum also includes questions and answers from the session, reflecting Sentinella's recollections and interactions with the committee staff.
title: Testimony of Retired FBI Special Agent Alan G. Sentinella Before SSC Executive Session
recipient: J. B. Adams, J. A. Mintz, W. R. Wannall, J. G. Deegan, R. L. Shackelford, W. O. Cregar, S. F. Phillips, The Attorney General, Director, FBI, James A. Wilderotter
